wikipedia_page.main:
Thomas Flavel (1793 – July 1829) was an English professional cricketer who played first-class cricket from 1821 to 1828.
An all-rounder who bowled and kept wicket, Flavel was mainly associated with Surrey.  He made 22 known appearances in first-class matches and represented the Players in the Gentlemen v Players series.

response: Six first-class matches were recorded in 1824. In the known records, the leading batsman and bowler were James Saunders and Thomas Flavel with 267 runs and 31 wickets respectively. Saunders' highest score was 92.
:All-England: Thomas Flavel, John Bowyer, James Saunders, William Barber, Tom Marsden, Fuller Pilch, George Dawson, Thomas Beagley, William Mathews, George Jarvis, Henry Jupp
